Tobago is a user interface framework for developing webapplications. The technical basis of the framework is JavaServer Faces. The main core represents a theme oriented JSF Render Kit.

Basic Controls
Tobago provides all standard controls of HTML like inputs, textareas, radiobuttons, checkboxes and buttons. Additionally Tobago provides you with complex controls, which are not natively supportet by simple HTML, including sheets, trees and tabs.

Validation
The main goal of Tobago is the development of applications which are interactive from the users point of view. Tobago makes it easy to validate input and helps the user to enter correct data.

Layout
Tobago provides a sophisticated layout managing mechanism which can be seen as a mixture of classic HTML table layout and Swing Gridbag layout.

Additional Features
Themes, Browser, Internationalisation.
Input controls for different kinds of text: single-line, multiline, formated.
Select controls allow input of one or multiple options.
Control elements for site navigation and to execute actions.

The sheet control is a simple solution for displaying table based information. The essential features are:
  • Paging: A defined range of data is displayed. Navigation is done with arrow buttons.
  • Sorting: By clicking a column header the appropriate column is sorted.
  • Inline-Editing: If needed, the values of cell contents can be directly changed or inserted by the user.
  • The column width can be resized by simply drag and drop the column border.
Click here to edit display attributes of the sheet.

The tree control displays a tree which is generated from application data. The key features are:
  • Attributes control the rendering of the tree.
  • The possibility to define the tree as "single" or "multiselect", i.e. select one or multiple nodes of the tree.
  • Editing mode for simple handling of tree structures inside the application.
Furthermore there is a TreeListbox Control, which can be described as a vertical tree. This is handy for categorization actions.
Multi selection, Leafs on same level only

The tab control provides so called tab panels.
  • Control can take place on server- or clientside.
  • Tab controls can be nested.
  • Inside each tab control any other controls can be used.
To close this popup window click close button.

Toolbars can be used for context sensitive actions inside box controls.
  • Toolbars can consist of images, text or both.
  • Toolbars can be completly integrated into a box header.
  • Actions can be displayed as drop down menues.

The menubar contains actions which are available application wide.
  • A menu is multilayer capable.
  • Menu actions can be executed on server- or clientside.
  • The actual status of menu entries can be displayed.

Tobago provides easy to use possibilities for validation of user input.
  • Syntactic and semantic validation is available.
  • Error messages can be positioned anywhere in the user interface.
  • Input elements, which are affected by the validation can be highlighted.

• Values in the first form are being stored temporarily by submitting the second form while the value in the second form is written into the model.
  • By submitting both form each value is stored into the model.
  • If the first input contains an error but the second one validates, the validation of the first form is deactivated.

Tobago supports nested forms and can treat each form seperatly:
  • Values can be stored seperatly into the model while already filled in input elements keep their values (temporarily)
  • If the validation of a form is activated but the actual value of this form is only stored temporarily, the validation is deactivated until the value is definitly stored into the model.

Tobago supports a big variety of displaying controls, so called designs or themes.
  • Choosing of themes can be application wide, user or group specific.
  • Images and other resources can be theme dependant as well as the application pages can be designed seperatly for each supported theme.

Tobago is completely browser independant. Support of the different browsers takes place in the JSF renderkit and does not have any effect on the business logic development.
  • Tobago supports common browsers: Internet Explorer, Mozilla and Netscape navigator.
  • Tobago reacts on the value delivered by the HTTP header 'User-Agent' to decide which controls have to be rendered.
  • Control defaulting: The implentation of themes can be both browser independant and based on other themes to prevent code redundancy.
  • More browsers can be supported easily.
  • Additional clients are supported, too: HTML, Simple HTML, WML

Tobago supports internationalization and localization.
  • Unicode is used internally.
  • Content in different languages can be provided by resource bundles.
  • Like content, images and scripts can be localized.

Tobago simplifies the design of websites.
  • Easy to use development of single- and multicolumn forms.
  • Cells can span over multiple rows and colums.
  • Automatic alignment of input field labels.

Theme configuration

In Tobago it's easy to give an application a well designed look. You can use prepared themes like speyside oder scarborough, just to name two. The only thing you have to do is configure them at the right place. This is done in the tobago-config.xml by defining a default theme.
